name: clear_primary_calendar
description: Clears a primary calendar by deleting all events associated with the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The calendar identifier, which can be `primary` for the current user's primary calendar, or obtained by calling `calendarList.list`.

name: create_access_control_rule
description: Create a new access control rule for the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The identifier of the calendar on which to create the rule.

sendNotifications.description: Specifies whether to send notifications to the rule's scope. Defaults to `True`.

type.description: The type of scope, for example, `user` or `group`.

value.description: The value of the scope, such as an email address.

scope.description: The scope of the resource to which the rule applies.

ruleId.description: A unique identifier for the rule; if not provided, one will be generated.

resource.description: The resource to which this rule applies.

name: create_calendar_list_entry
description: Adds a calendar to the user's calendar list.

id.description: A unique identifier for the calendar list entry; a UUID is generated if not provided.

summary.description: Summary of the calendar list entry.

description.description: A description of the calendar list entry.

timeZone.description: The time zone identifier for the calendar list entry (e.g., "America/New_York").

resource.description: The calendar list entry to create.

name: create_event
description: Create a new event in the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: Identifier of the calendar, defaulting to "primary".

id.description: The unique identifier for the event, automatically generated as a UUID if not provided.

summary.description: The summary or title of the event.

dateTime.description: The start date and time in ISO 8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

end.description: The end time of the event.

recurrence.description:
An array of strings specifying the event's recurrence rules in `RRULE` format (e.g., `["RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=MO,WE"]`). The following `RRULE` parameters are supported:
- `FREQ`: `SECONDLY`, `MINUTELY`, `HOURLY`, `DAILY`, `WEEKLY`, `MONTHLY`, `YEARLY` (required)
- `INTERVAL`: Positive integer (default: 1)
- `COUNT`: Positive integer
- `UNTIL`: `YYYYMMDDTHHMMSSZ` or `YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS`
- `BYDAY`: `SU`,`MO`,`TU`,`WE`,`TH`,`FR`,`SA` (e.g., `1SU`, `-1MO`)
- `BYMONTH`: 1-12
- `BYMONTHDAY`: 1-31
- `BYYEARDAY`: 1-366
- `BYWEEKNO`: 1-53
- `BYHOUR`: 0-23
- `BYMINUTE`: 0-59
- `BYSECOND`: 0-59
- `BYSETPOS`: 1 to 366 or -366 to -1
- `WKST`: `SU`,`MO`,`TU`,`WE`,`TH`,`FR`,`SA` (week start)

organizer.description: Whether the attendee is the organizer

self.description: Whether the attendee is the user

resource.description: Whether the attendee is a resource

optional.description: Whether the attendee's presence is optional

attendees.description: A list of objects representing event attendees.

useDefault.description: Whether to use the default reminders for the event.

overrides.description: A list of overrides for the reminders.

location.description: The location where the event will take place.

resource.description: The event resource to create.

name: create_secondary_calendar
description: Creates a secondary calendar.

timeZone.description: The time zone identifier for the calendar (e.g., "America/New_York").

location.description: The calendar's geographic location as free-form text.

etag.description: The ETag of the resource, used for optimistic concurrency control.

kind.description: The type of the resource, which must be `calendar#calendar`.

allowedConferenceSolutionTypes.description: The list of conference solution types supported for this calendar; valid values are `eventHangout`, `eventNamedHangout`, and `hangoutsMeet`.

conferenceProperties.description: The conference-related properties of the calendar.

resource.description: The calendar resource to create.

name: delete_access_control_rule
description: Delete an access control rule from the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar from which to delete the rule.

ruleId.description: The ID of the rule to delete.

name: delete_calendar_list_entry
description: Deletes a calendar list entry from the user's calendar list.

calendarId.description: ID of the calendar list entry to delete.

name: delete_event
description: Delete an event from the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: Identifier of the calendar containing the event to delete.

eventId.description: The identifier of the event to delete.

sendNotifications.description: Indicates whether to send notifications about the deletion; defaults to `False`.

sendUpdates.description: Whether to send updates about the deletion; possible values are "all", "externalOnly", or "none"; defaults to None.

name: delete_secondary_calendar
description: Deletes a secondary calendar from the user's calendar list; primary calendars cannot be deleted.

calendarId.description: The identifier of the secondary calendar to delete; retrieve IDs using `calendarList.list`.

name: get_access_control_rule
description: Retrieves an access control rule from the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar to get the rule from.

ruleId.description: The ID of the rule to retrieve.

name: get_calendar_and_event_colors
description: Returns calendar and event color definitions.

name: get_calendar_list_entry
description: Retrieve a calendar list entry from the user's calendar list by its ID, or use 'primary' for the primary calendar.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar list entry to retrieve, or `primary` to return the primary calendar.

name: get_calendar_metadata
description: Retrieves metadata for a specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The identifier of the calendar; use "primary" to access the user's primary calendar, or retrieve other IDs via `calendarList.list`.

name: get_event
description: Retrieve an event from the specified calendar.

alwaysIncludeEmail.description: Deprecated and ignored, as email addresses are always included in the response. Defaults to False.

calendarId.description: The calendar identifier; defaults to "primary" for the current user's primary calendar if not provided. Retrieve other IDs using `calendarList.list`.

eventId.description: The mandatory identifier of the event to retrieve.

maxAttendees.description: The maximum number of non-negative attendees to return; defaults to None to return all attendees.

timeZone.description: A string specifying the time zone for the response (e.g., `America/New_York`); defaults to the calendar's time zone.

name: import_event
description: Imports an event into the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The identifier of the calendar.

conferenceDataVersion.description: The version of the conference data; defaults to 0.

supportsAttachments.description: Indicates whether the event supports attachments; defaults to `False`.

id.description: The event's identifier; a new UUID is generated if omitted.

dateTime.description: The date and time, formatted as ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

start.description: The event's start time, specified as a dictionary with a `dateTime` key in ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ) format.

dateTime.description: The end time, formatted as ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

end.description: The end time of the event, specified as a dictionary with a `dateTime` key in ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ) format.

resource.description: A dictionary defining the event to import, including `summary`, optional `id` and `description`, and `start`/`end` times, where `dateTime` values are in ISO 8601 format.

name: list_access_control_rules
description: List all access control rules for the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar to list rules for.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of rules to return, defaulting to 100.

pageToken.description: A token for pagination, which is not currently implemented.

showDeleted.description: Includes deleted rules; this functionality is not implemented.

name: list_calendar_list_entries
description: Lists all user's calendar list entries.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of calendar list entries to return; must be a positive integer and defaults to 100.

name: list_event_instances
description: Returns instances of a specified recurring event, returning only the event itself as its sole instance without expanding recurrences.

alwaysIncludeEmail.description: Specifies whether to include the event creator's email address; defaults to `False`.

calendarId.description: The identifier of the calendar; defaults to "primary" if not provided.

maxAttendees.description: The maximum non-negative number of attendees to return; defaults to `None` to return all.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of instances to return, which must be a positive integer and defaults to 250.

originalStart.description: The original start time of the instance, in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

pageToken.description: A string token used to retrieve the next page of results.

showDeleted.description: Indicates whether to include deleted instances; defaults to `False`.

timeMax.description: The maximum time for instances to return, in ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ) format.

timeMin.description: The minimum time to return instances, formatted as ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

timeZone.description: Specifies the response time zone, formatted as `Continent/City` (e.g., `America/New_York`), defaulting to the calendar's time zone.

name: list_events
description: Lists events from the specified calendar.

calendarId.description: The calendar's identifier; defaults to `None`. If `None`, `list_events` treats it as a distinct, valid calendar identifier or relies on external logic to map to concepts like 'primary'.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of events to return, a positive integer that defaults to 250.

timeMin.description: The minimum time for events, specified as an ISO datetime string.

timeMax.description: The maximum time of events to return, formatted as an ISO 8601 datetime string (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

q.description: A query string to filter events by.

singleEvents.description: A boolean indicating whether to expand recurring events into individual instances within the time range; otherwise, only the base event is returned. Defaults to False.

orderBy.description: The order of events, which must be 'startTime' or 'updated'; defaults to None.

name: move_event
description: Move an event from one calendar to another.

calendarId.description: The identifier of the source calendar.

eventId.description: The identifier of the event to move.

destination.description: The identifier of the destination calendar.

sendNotifications.description: Controls whether notifications are sent about the move; defaults to `False`.

sendUpdates.description: Specifies whether to send updates about the move; possible values are `"all"`, `"externalOnly"`, or `"none"`. Defaults to `None`.

name: patch_access_control_rule
description: Updates an existing access control rule's `role` or `scope` fields.

calendarId.description: The calendar ID that contains the rule.

ruleId.description: The ID of the rule to update.

sendNotifications.description: Specifies whether to send notifications; defaults to `True`.

role.description: A string representing the new role to assign (e.g., 'reader', 'writer').

scope.description: A dictionary defining the rule's scope, containing `type` (e.g., 'user', 'group') and `value` (e.g., email address).

resource.description: A dictionary containing fields to update, such as `role` (string) and `scope` (a dictionary with `type` and `value` strings).

name: patch_calendar_list_entry
description: Updates specific fields of an existing calendar list entry.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar list entry to patch, or "primary" to patch the primary calendar.

colorRgbFormat.description: A boolean specifying whether to use RGB color format; defaults to `False`.

summary.description: The string summary of the calendar list entry.

description.description: The description of the calendar list entry.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar list entry, such as "America/New_York".

resource.description: A dictionary containing fields to update the calendar list entry, such as `summary` (str), `description` (str), and `timeZone` (str).

name: patch_calendar_metadata
description: Update specific fields of an existing calendar.

calendarId.description: Identifier for the calendar, which can be the keyword `"primary"` for the user's primary calendar or a specific ID retrieved with the `calendarList.list` method.

resource.description: The calendar metadata properties to update.

name: patch_event
description: Updates specific fields of an existing event.

calendarId.description: The calendar identifier, defaulting to `primary`.

eventId.description: Identifier for the event to update.

summary.description: The new summary or title for the event.

description.description: The new description for the event.

dateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2025-03-10T09:00:00Z`).
A date-time string in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2025-03-10T09:30:00Z`).

organizer.description: Whether the attendee is the organizer.

self.description: Whether this represents the calendar owner.

resource.description: Whether the attendee is a resource (room, equipment).

optional.description: Whether this is an optional attendee.

attendees.description: The new list of attendees, where each attendee is an object.

recurrence.description: New recurrence rules for the event.

useDefault.description: Specifies whether to use the default calendar reminders.

overrides.description: A list of objects, each defining a custom reminder override.

resource.description: An object containing the fields to update, conforming to a validated structure.

name: quick_add_event
description: Creates an event from a natural language text description.

calendarId.description: The calendar identifier; must not be empty or whitespace.

sendNotifications.description: Whether to send notifications about the creation; defaults to `False`.

sendUpdates.description: Specifies whether to send creation updates, with possible values: "all", "externalOnly", or "none". Defaults to None.

text.description: A natural language description of the event to parse, for example: "Lunch with John at noon tomorrow".

name: stop_notification_channel
description: Stops watching resources through a channel, removing it from active channels and preventing further notifications.

resource.description: A dictionary containing the channel's identifier, specified by the `id` field.

name: update_access_control_rule
description: Replaces an existing access control rule with new role and scope data.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar containing the rule.

ruleId.description: The ID of the rule to update.

sendNotifications.description: A boolean indicating whether to send notifications; defaults to `True`.

role.description: The new role to assign, such as 'reader' or 'writer'.

scope.description: A dictionary specifying the new scope, containing `type` (e.g., 'user', 'group') and `value` (e.g., email address).

resource.description: A dictionary containing the complete new rule data, including the `role` (string) and `scope` (a dictionary with `type` and `value` strings).

name: update_calendar_list_entry
description: Replaces an existing calendar list entry with new data.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar list entry to replace; use 'primary' to replace the primary calendar.

colorRgbFormat.description: A boolean indicating whether to use RGB color format; defaults to `False`.

summary.description: A string representing the summary of the calendar list entry.

description.description: The description of the calendar list entry.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar list entry (e.g., "America/New_York").

resource.description: The `Dict[str, Any]` resource data used to replace the calendar list entry, including `summary` (str), `description` (str), and `timeZone` (str, e.g., "America/New_York").

name: update_calendar_metadata
description: Updates an existing calendar's metadata.

calendarId.description: Identifier for the calendar. Use "primary" for the current user's primary calendar or an ID retrieved from the `calendarList.list` method.

timeZone.description: The calendar's time zone identifier, such as `America/New_York`.

resource.description: The calendar resource containing the metadata to update.

name: update_event
description: Replaces an existing event with new data.

eventId.description: The ID of the event to update.

calendarId.description: Identifier of the calendar.

dateTime.description: Start date and time in ISO 8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

timeZone.description: The time zone of the event's start time.

dateTime.description: The end date and time in ISO 8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

timeZone.description: The time zone for the end time.

recurrence.description:
An array of recurrence rule strings for the event in RRULE format, such as `["RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=MO,WE"]`.

The following RRULE components are supported:
*   **`FREQ`**: `SECONDLY`, `MINUTELY`, `HOURLY`, `DAILY`, `WEEKLY`, `MONTHLY`, `YEARLY` (required)
*   **`INTERVAL`**: Positive integer (default: 1)
*   **`COUNT`**: Positive integer for the number of occurrences
*   **`UNTIL`**: Date-time in `YYYYMMDDTHHMMSSZ` or `YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS` format
*   **`BYDAY`**: `SU`,`MO`,`TU`,`WE`,`TH`,`FR`,`SA` (with optional ordinal, e.g., `1SU`, `-1MO`)
*   **`BYMONTH`**: 1-12
*   **`BYMONTHDAY`**: 1-31
*   **`BYYEARDAY`**: 1-366
*   **`BYWEEKNO`**: 1-53
*   **`BYHOUR`**: 0-23
*   **`BYMINUTE`**: 0-59
*   **`BYSECOND`**: 0-59
*   **`BYSETPOS`**: 1 to 366 or -366 to -1
*   **`WKST`**: Week start day (`SU`,`MO`,`TU`,`WE`,`TH`,`FR`,`SA`)

organizer.description: Whether the attendee is the organizer

self.description: Whether the attendee is the user

resource.description: Whether the attendee is a resource

optional.description: Whether the attendee's presence is optional

attendees.description: A list of objects representing event attendees.

useDefault.description: Specifies whether to use the default reminders.

resource.description: An event resource containing the properties to update.

name: watch_access_control_rule_changes
description: Watches for access control rule changes.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar to watch.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of rules to return; defaults to 100.

pageToken.description: A token for pagination, currently not implemented.

showDeleted.description: A boolean indicating whether to include deleted rules; this feature is not implemented.

syncToken.description: A token for synchronization, which is currently not implemented.

id.description: The channel ID; if not provided, one is generated.

resource.description: A dictionary for watch configuration, including `type` (defaults to "web_hook") and an optional `id` (generated if not provided).

name: watch_calendar_list_changes
description: Sets up a watch for changes to calendar list entries.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of calendar list entries to return, ranging from 1 to 250, and defaulting to 100.

minAccessRole.description: The minimum access role required to view calendar list entries; must be one of `freeBusyReader`, `owner`, `reader`, or `writer`.

pageToken.description: Token specifying which result page to return.

showDeleted.description: Determines whether to include deleted calendar list entries in the result, defaulting to `False`.

showHidden.description: Whether to show hidden entries; defaults to `False`.

syncToken.description: A token obtained from the `nextSyncToken` field returned on the last page of a previous list request that cannot be used with `minAccessRole`.

id.description: The channel ID; if omitted, one is generated.

type.description: The type of watch; defaults to `web_hook`.

resource.description: A dictionary specifying the watch configuration, including `id` (str, generated if not provided) and `type` (str, defaults to "web_hook").

name: watch_event_changes
description: Watch for changes to events in a specified calendar.

alwaysIncludeEmail.description: Specifies whether to always include the event creator's email address, defaulting to `False`.

calendarId.description: Identifier of the calendar, which defaults to the user's primary calendar if not provided.

eventTypes.description: The types of events to watch, which must be one or more of `default`, `focusTime`, or `outOfOffice`.

iCalUID.description: The iCalUID of the event for filtering.

maxAttendees.description: A positive integer representing the maximum number of attendees to return per event.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of events to return, as a positive integer, with a default of 250.

orderBy.description: The sort order for the events. Must be one of: `startTime`, `updated`.

pageToken.description: A token that identifies the page of results to return.

privateExtendedProperty.description: A filter for a private extended property, formatted as `key=value`.

q.description: A free-text query to find matching events.

sharedExtendedProperty.description: Shared extended property filter specified in `key=value` format.

showDeleted.description: Specifies whether to include deleted events, defaulting to `False`.

showHiddenInvitations.description: Specifies whether to include hidden invitations, defaulting to `False`.

singleEvents.description: Whether to expand recurring events into instances (defaults to `False`).

syncToken.description: A token from the `nextSyncToken` field, returned on the last page of results from a previous list request.

timeMax.description: Exclusive upper bound for an event's start time, formatted as an ISO 8601 timestamp (e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

timeMin.description: The lower bound (inclusive) for an event's end time, formatted as an ISO 8601 timestamp (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

timeZone.description: Time zone for the response (e.g., `America/New_York`), defaulting to the calendar's time zone.

updatedMin.description: A lower bound for an event's last modification time, specified in ISO 8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`).

id.description: A unique identifier for the watch; a new UUID is generated if not provided.

type.description: The type of watch, defaulting to `web_hook`.

address.description: The address where notifications are sent.

resource.description: The watch configuration.
